meanings.definition: The belief that psychological factors are fundamental in explaining all aspects of human behavior.
meanings.sent1: Some people adhere to psychologism, thinking that emotions drive all actions.
meanings.sent2: Psychologism suggests that our thoughts and feelings greatly influence our behavior.
meanings.sent3: At the party, Sarah joked that psychologism must be why she always craves chocolate when stressed.
meanings.sent4: In the world of marketing, psychologism plays a key role in understanding consumer behavior.
meanings.sent5: The professor's lecture on psychologism made the concept easy to grasp and remember.

meanings.definition: The practice of explaining philosophical or logical concepts in terms of psychological principles.
meanings.sent1: The philosopher's psychologism led him to interpret abstract ideas through the lens of human emotions.
meanings.sent2: When using psychologism, one may analyze complex theories by considering underlying mental processes.
meanings.sent3: During the debate, John humorously applied psychologism to explain why people prefer cats over dogs.
meanings.sent4: The writer's use of psychologism in the novel added a unique layer of depth to the characters' motivations.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting beautifully captured the essence of psychologism in a visually striking way.
